feed.title: Alabama Reflector
feed.description: Clarity today for a better tomorrow

items.title: States are quietly cutting child care funding — and families are out of options
items.description: Families in Indiana and other states are losing child care assistance due to federal funding cuts.

items.title: U.S. Supreme Court temporarily blocks November SNAP payments
items.description: The Supreme Court has temporarily blocked a lower court ruling requiring full SNAP payments for November.

items.title: Health care premiums to surge for Alabamians with no ACA deal in Congress
items.description: Without congressional action, thousands of Alabamians face significant health insurance premium hikes.

items.title: Alabama bill would further restrict communications for sex offenders
items.description: A new Alabama bill aims to further limit communication rights for registered sex offenders in the state.

items.title: States’ death penalty policies are heading in sharply different directions
items.description: While some states ramp up executions, others continue to move toward abolition or moratoriums.

items.title: Trump administration issues November SNAP benefits, then asks Supreme Court to intervene
items.description: The Trump administration has distributed SNAP benefits but is appealing the lower court decision.

items.title: Full November SNAP benefits to be issued by Trump administration despite shutdown
items.description: Despite a government shutdown, November SNAP benefits will still be distributed to eligible households.

items.title: Montgomery police arrest fifth suspect in October shooting
items.description: Montgomery police have arrested a fifth suspect connected to a late-October shooting.

items.title: U.S. Senate fails to pass war powers resolution blocking Trump attacks on Venezuela
items.description: A Senate effort to limit Trump’s authority for military action in Venezuela narrowly failed on Friday.
